title: What does the Bible say about wisdom and understanding? - Quora

response.answer_text: Deu. 4:5 “Behold, I have taught you statutes and judgments, even as the LORD my God commanded me, that ye should do so in the land whither ye go to possess it. Keep therefore and do them; for this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the nations, which shall hear all these statutes, and say, Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.” 1 Kings 4:29 “And God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding exceeding much, and largeness of heart, even as the sand that is on the sea shore.” Job 12:12 “With the ancient is wisdom; and in length of days understanding.” Job 28:28 “And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.” Psalm 111:10 “The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do his commandments: his praise endures for ever.” Prov. 2:6 “For the LORD gives wisdom: out of his mouth comes knowledge and understanding.” Prov. 3:19 “The LORD by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.” 1 Cor 1:19 “For it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.” Rev. 13:18 “Here is wisdom. Let him that hath understanding count the number of the beast: for it is the number of a man; and his number is Six hundred threescore and six.”

response.answer_text: There’s actually quite a distinction as the Bible describes wisdom and understanding in the Old Testament and then in the New Testament. In the Old Testament proverbs gives us a lot of advice how to be smart, teach children, understand people, etc. Then in the New Testament, Jesus Christ became the fulfillment of wisdom and understanding to the world. And this depends on if we have a relationship with him. The Bible explains the wisdom of those who understand what he did as a sacrifice to die for our sins and the understanding that if we ask him into our lives, we will be saved and not separated from him. This ultimately becomes the context and key to why the Bible was written. The old testament describes the need for a savior, and the new testament explains who that Savior is in Jesus. This ultimately is the key to wisdom and understanding…
